newsitem.title: UK: UK'S CLARKE SAYS STERLING WILL NOT SHADOW EURO.
newsitem.headline: UK'S CLARKE SAYS STERLING WILL NOT SHADOW EURO.

text.p: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke said there was no question of the pound shadowing a single European currency.
"There is no question whatever in the EMI document of shadowing the euro or any other currency," Clarke said.
"Sterling is now a floating currency, I have no intention of shadowing any currency so long as it remains floating and I think it would be futile and damaging to do so."
Clarke earlier said he was releasing a European Monetary Institute document to clear up press reports that documents had been withheld from members of parliament.
